reviews.text:
Good food and drinks especially the yakitori platter and passion fruit margarita.
Quick service as well. The restaurant decor is nice so for me it added to the overall good experience.
Will be back!!

This place is pretty cool. It's like a city inside a building.  Great place for izakaya and the ramen ins pretty good to boot.  We got some sushi this time and that was also great.
Ambiance was inviting, food and drinks were amazing, and service was great
Best izakaya in NY, so pretty inside and staff are nice. Food is awesome.
Everything about this place was perfect! The ambience of the restaurant is amazing. The dishes were delicious and our servers were very attentive. We had a great night and we will be back!

5 star decor & service! Giving 4 star overall because of the curry. Curry is mediocre. Eel and beef skewers are the best. For people passionate about Japanese culture, I think you wonâ€™t be disappointed by the atmosphere. Street parking.
Great atmosphere and wonderful yummy Japanese food. I love taking my family here for dinner.

Beautiful decorations, just like izakaya I've been to in Japan. The oden & chawanmushi were mediocre, but the skewers were really good. We got the variety set, but probably would just buy individually and pick my favorites next time. It's honestly the most expensive Japanese menu I've experienced, which probably due to inflation and tariffs, so can't say whether that's normal in NYC or not, since I ate mostly Korean food while I was visiting.
I loved the atmosphere inside. Everyone was so attentive. Weâ€™ll definitely come here again.
Definitely the best spot to come for drinks and sushi this itâ€™s like my 4th time coming and it never disappointsâ€¦! And the workers are so nice amazing service definitely coming back again..!

The food isnâ€™t particularly special. It tastes fine but feels quite standard, nothing that really stands out. My only complaint is the beef skewer, which was overly salty. Iâ€™m not sure if it was a heavy hand with the seasoning or just how it was marinated. The real highlight is the interior. The space is large with high ceilings, creating a comfortable and open atmosphere. The Japanese-inspired design is charming, and the lighting adds a warm and pleasant touch.
Love this place 10/10 atmosphere, food , deinks, service , and presentation. Sam the bartender is very nice and helpful
Excellent
The food and drinks were good, but seating could be more comfortable. Great place for short catch-ups, not for long stays

Absolutely loved my visit to Izakaya Nana! The atmosphere feels cozy and modern at the same time. I really wanted to go into their private room with all the anime wallpaper but sadly two people canâ€™t reserve it. This place is perfect for a relaxed night out. The wagyu was  delicious and cooked perfectly and full of flavor. It melted straight in my mouth. You can tell they really care about quality ingredient and they cook it in front of you. Thereâ€™s three options for the seasoning of the wagyu. I also tried the dragon fruit drink (alcoholic) which was refreshing, beautifully presented, and surprisingly well-balanced. They also have a happy hour~
Fun place to visit. They decorated this place so you feel like you are visiting a street of Japan. Food was good.
Always good food

If your looking for a nice atmosphere with some delicious japanese food, this is the place to be! Bar friendly, staff friendly, and when the seasons right, the decor is nice! Especially for Halloween! Come check them out!

Excelente!!!
El ramen Tonkotsu espectacular!!!
Great happy hour specials at the bar and super cute and immersive atmosphere.
The food was good! Loved the flavors and presentation, super fresh. The vibe was nice and cozy too. A solid spot if youâ€™re craving Japanese food.

Iâ€™ve been to this restaurant a few times and have had good experiences every time. The service is quick and friendly, the food is great, and the restaurant itself is beautiful. Would definitely recommend!

I liked it so much I went twice in one day!! No joke. Workers were probably thinking, â€œAgain..?â€
So I have been putting this place off because I thought it was kinda pricey but lemme tell you. Fantastic. The food here is great. I had the lunch omakase and the sweet potato ice cream for lunch. All were sooo good. I never had sweet potato with ice cream. I was put off but Iâ€™m glad I tried something new. Then in the evening I went for dinner with my loved one and he liked it as well. Cocktails 10/10 so flavorful. Green tea is good. Skewers. The matcha crepes. Oysters. Donâ€™t even get me started on the atmosphere. It is like mini Kyoto or mini Japan. A lovely gem in Queens!

Izakaya Nana is such a vibe! The food is delicious â€” fresh sashimi, perfectly crispy karaage, and creative small plates that are just fun to share. The cocktails are gorgeous and taste as good as they look, and the whole place has that cool, cozy energy that makes you want to stay all night. The staff are super friendly and make the experience even better. Itâ€™s the perfect spot for a casual date or girlsâ€™ night out. ğŸ¶ğŸ£ğŸ’«
Prices are pretty high, great place to eat, bring a dadye sit down take some drinks...etc

This is one of the best sushi experiences I have had.  If you like anime Japanese food/culture definitely visit here. I wanted to get into one of the theme rooms but it was not available. Food was amazing drinks were fantastic!
I came to this place twice, service and food was great, but the price is a bit steep for Flushing. However, it is a great alternative for Izakaya rather traveling to Manhattan

Fools actually above  expectation. Service are really good and the atmosphere and decorations are all pretty good. Will definitely go back for the skewers. Personally, I think the skewers are better than the sashimi or sushi. The steam egg bowl is amazing and also the egg omelettes are beautiful.
As soon as I walked in, I was transported to Kyoto alley ways looking for a small shop to eat.  The restaurant design is amazing.  So is the food.  Thank you!
è£…ä¿®é£æ ¼éå¸¸æ—¶å°šï¼ŒæœåŠ¡æ€åº¦ä¹Ÿéå¸¸å¥½ã€‚

Food is great and all that, but Amex platinum card holders please beware: although this restaurant is listed on Resy to qualify for your Resy dining credit, they use Chowbus as their processing service therefore it will not qualify as a Resy restaurant! I explicitly asked the restaurant if they use a different crediting service for payment and they said no with confidence and assured me Iâ€™ll get my Resy credit.
I came here for the toro ikura Don and it didnâ€™t disappoint!! The yakitori platter was grilled really well and super seasoned. Every bite was enjoyable.

Its truly a wonderful experience. You feel very welcomed and treated with a lot of care. From their drinks to their food the presentation looks just like in their pictures. And the taste phenomenal. My girlfriend and I will definitely be coming back many times to enjoy everything and try all of their foods.
Delicious food

It was so delicious and enjoyable.

Iâ€™ve been here twice so far, and both experiences were great! My favorite dish is the grilled chicken wingsâ€”theyâ€™re super juicy and tasty. The other food is delicious, too! Not to mention, the staff are friendly, and the vibe and decor are well-cultivated and thoughtfully designed. This is definitely a great Japanese restaurant in the Flushing area to share with friends and family. Highly recommended!

Had a fantastic experience at Izakaya Nana! The food was absolutely delicious and full of flavor. The Crazy Nana roll, yakitori platter, and lobster potato salad were all especially goodâ€”highly recommend trying them. Service was amazingâ€”attentive, friendly, and fast. The decor was also really nice, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. The whole experience made me feel like I was back in Japan. Definitely a place Iâ€™d come back to and recommend to others.

The atmosphere was really nice and found myself just staring at the decorations half the time! The staff was really welcoming even though it was close to closing time. There were alot of great food choices and drinks. I had the Tornado Omelet Fried Rice and really enjoyed it. I'd definitely recommend for a cute date spot or even solo dining!

Very nice place. The atmosphere and vibe was great. Food was delicious and had a great time with friends. Staff was very friendly and this was my first time going there. I really enjoyed the experience and will definitely come back

The atmosphere is very nice, a lot of Japanese motifs. It's cleanly and the servers are responsive to the button that you press.

This place has excellent Yakitori (japanese shish kebab) I had the:
1. Harami, it's beef and it was tender and juicy
2. Butabara: Pork Belly, very good but I've had better pork belly elsewhere
3. Negima: chicken thigh seasoned perfectly and tender

All were good and im glad I ordered.

Main course: impossible Unadon, so very good and tender if you like grilled eel. It comes with folded egg on bottom, very filling.

All the foods were season well (delicious), savory and not overly salty. Im suprised that a place like this exists in flushing and not St. Marks.

For you drinkers, there's a really nice big open bar. PSA: Please drink responsibly, if you drink like a fish please Uber. Flushing does not need anymore bad drivers.

This place is a rare gem, if you like Japanese food you gotta come here, if not... then you will keep supporting mediocrity.

A beautiful setting and wonderful, helpful staff! The Dancing Girl Roll was delicious and the Shrimp Tempura was also very good. Edamame was okay; a bit spicy, but served at room temperature. They have sake as well, served in nice cups.

Had a great time dining here. The whole dining, atmosphere was awesome. We got lucky to dine next to the bar and the environment just felt like we are in japan. The service was top notch, everyone was so friendly. Would definitely recommend.

This was my favorite food spot when I came to NY to visit. Food 10/10. Atmosphere 10/10 the service was 10/10 and I truly wish I lived nearby so I could come here every week. Even made a new friend at the bar! Definitely suggest coming with a big group too. You'll get access to the big decorated rooms. Highly recommend this for anyone who is a big anime or manga fan ğŸ˜

I must say this is a very unique place when I walked in I felt like I was in some sort of village in Japan.  We sat down in a private room which was spacious. I liked the anime all over the wall.  Service is good, food is good, vibe is good.

Izakaya Nana is an absolute hidden gem in Flushing! The atmosphere is lively and welcoming, just like a true Tokyo izakaya. The food is outstandingâ€”fresh sashimi, perfectly grilled skewers, and flavorful small plates that keep you wanting more. The staff is warm and attentive, making the whole experience even better.

If youâ€™re looking for authentic Japanese comfort food with great vibes, Izakaya Nana is a must-visit. Easily one of my top spots in New York!

Izakaya Nana is a hidden gem in Flushing that perfectly blends authentic Izakaya aesthetics with excellent food and service.

The service was attentive and well-timed, matching the beautifully curated ambiance. The combination of high-end dishes, cohesive dÃ©cor, and warm hospitality makes it perfect for group gatherings, date nights, or just a cozy night out.

The toro bowl was pricey but really good!Skewers were decent but nothing that blows you away - my favorite was actually the mushroom! The only thing I really wish they could change was the lighting in the rooms because itâ€™s sooo dark.

The interior decoration just yells Japanese tavern. I love the all the booths they got, very good privacy. The oden with its aromatic broth and plump fish cakes is delicious. The karage is very juicy and tender but tad bit oily. The assorted appetizers really let you have a taste of everything which is nice.

Izakaya Nana is a truly authentic experience. If you haven't had a chance to pay a visit to Japan, Izakaya Nana is a great local choice!

Walking in, you are immediately placed in an atmosphere where it feels exactly as if you were in Tokyo, Japan. Each room is designed differently, so even if you went multiple times you'd have an entirely different atmospheric experience.

I went with a bunch of friends and we all bought something different. My personal favorite was the Impossible Unadon; an 8oz eel over tamago and rice. It was incredibly filling and delicious, very well worth the $34.99 for the dish.

Every item on the menu feels like you are getting what you paid for, with no shortage of quality or quantity.

The service was remarkable; press a button and they shall appear. Each server was friendly and made sure you were taken care of. They'd go over your items to make sure you received everything you ordered.

I wouldn't think twice about coming back here, as Izakaya Nana really scratches that itch that makes me miss my visit to Japan.

Amazing experience. This was my first stop in my 4 day trip to NYC. The atmosphere is gorgeous,  it feels like youâ€™re stepping into another world when you walk in and see the Japanese themed interior. Not an affordable place if youâ€™re on a budget but a good place if youâ€™re solo or a couple. Food was absolutely delicious, I got the Katsu Curry while my sister got the Tonkatsu Ramen. Both meals were cooked well and brought out in under 20 minutes after ordering. Wet wipes and water was provided to you as you are seated. Service was incredibly fast, we never waited longer than 1 minute to be helped. Overall an amazing experience.

Izakaya Nana is truly an experience that transports you straight to Japan. From the moment you walk in, the ambiance is warm, inviting, and beautifully captures the essence of Japanese culture. As a first-time visitor, I wanted to try a bit of everythingâ€”and Iâ€™m so glad I did.

Every dish was a standout, from the savory, juicy meats to the thoughtfully prepared sushi. The drinks were just as impressive and paired perfectly with the food. Itâ€™s clear that a lot of care goes into every detail, both in the food and the atmosphere.

I love this place! Sam, our server, always gives us such a warm welcome and makes the experience even better. I especially love their hamachi kamaâ€”itâ€™s perfectly done every timeâ€”and the crepe dessert is the perfect way to end the meal. Highly recommend!
Actually so good. The atmosphere is beautiful, service amazing, and food was delicious. Everything came out so fast and the food were all so fresh. Would highly recommend!

I went today with my husband and we instantly fell in love!! Everything is fresh and so flavorful. 100000/10 would definitely come here with my friends next time!! They staff is so sweet as well and they are so clean.

Wonderful service and interior design, but so expensive for the portion size. The only thing worth getting here is the eel bowl. Do not get the crab dish as itâ€™s almost all mayo. Spent $230 for 3 people and we werenâ€™t even full. Late night happy hour is BOGO beer and sake, and select cocktails.

I had an incredible dining experience thanks to Cindy, who truly went above and beyond as our server. From the moment we were seated, she was warm and attentive. She checked in on us at just the right times and made sure our food and drinks arrived promptly. Her friendly personality and genuine care for customer satisfaction made our evening feel extra special.
If youâ€™re dining at this Izakaya, I highly recommend asking for Cindy, you wonâ€™t be disappointed. Sheâ€™s the kind of server who elevates the whole experience.

Went here on a friday night around 7 without a reservation and got seated right away. Seemed mostly full and we were able to see some of the special rooms, looked really nice. The bar is pretty big with a cool design inside. We had a table so we had a call button to use whenever we wanted to order and they came right away.

We started with a house hot sake, yellowtail carpaccio, and 2 items off what seemed like a limited time menu the beef miyoshi and spiced cucumbers. The fish was really fresh and tasted great, the beef and cucumbers were super tasty.

We switched over to house cold sake and ordered the oysters which come with uni and ikura on top, and got the small order of wagyu and a waiter came to the table with a hot stone and grilled it for us. All of it was great and the house sakes are very good for the price.

We then ordered some yakitori, shishito peppers, scallops, eel, pork belly, and steak, and the delicious brussels sprout tempura. The pork belly and steak were really good. We tried the matcha crepe cake and the taiyaki desserts, the taiyaki was the winner for us.

Overall some really great food that was tasty and fun to eat. The house sake was really good too. Looking forward to coming back with more people

I came around 1pm on a weekday and was seated immediately. The decor was very cool and reminded me of Japan. The food was surprisingly good too. I ordered the omakase special and the chicken, eel, and beef yakitori. Iâ€™d recommend this place for good Japanese food!

We loved this place! Very chic and cute interior! They have the best lunch specials . All the decorations here are so cute
We got three lunch boxes and it comes with assorted dishes
Also strongly recommend the spicy habarura and the hamari beef skewers. However their oden is over cooked! Ot was too mushy
